owner.name: Homebush LDV and MG - Service, Parts and Accessories Centre (Owner)

user_reviews_extended.Name: Ceren Saracoglu
user_reviews_extended.Description: I would firstly like to thank LDV Homebush for the wonderful experience they gave me. They quickly took my car in and told me the process in a professional and polite manner. I‚Äôm extremely happy with the service for my 2024 t60 max luxe plus. He took account all the recalls that my car had and fixed them all. My car drives even smoother now. LDV Homebush definitely doesn‚Äôt rip you off like the Kirawee LDV who quoted me $560!! I will certainly be coming back for my 10,000k‚Äôs service. Thanks again LDV Homebush for everything.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Sean Dixon
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Weeks after the car was due to come back and I can't get a call back from the case manager. No form of correspondence and if you get somebody on the phone, all they do is say the person that never calls will call.. Apparently the manager gets CC'd on emails asking for a call but that doesn't change a thing. If you're planning to buy an LDV or MG with this as your local service centre, just buy another brand.
To the mechanics credit, I‚Äôve never had an issue in that respect. Their customer service is just non existent.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Bella Callaghan
user_reviews_extended.Description: Incredible Service! I called about an issue and within 3 hours my car was dropped, repaired and back home. I am beyond satisfied with the customer service I received from every step of the process; from the lady who answered my call, the mechanic who repaired my car and the man who handed me back my keys. The process was easy, efficient and extremely professional. I highly recommend this service centre.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Evan Faasau
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I took my D90 for 40000Km service on the 29th July. After the service drove home and had noticed once i got home, that my dash cam had been disconnected.  (This caused me to check my history, which i wouldn‚Äôt have)
8.40am technician commences the service, completed 9.51am, my dash cam disconnected after the service at 9.51am.
My car was ready for me at 11.30am. (Meanwhile ive been sitting in the lobby since 7.45am, because i live too far away from the service centre.)

What did they do to my car for over an hour?

Why would they disconnect my dash cam? (My thought is they doing the dodgy with my vehicle.)

I called to get answer and i was told they will call me back.( Still waiting ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è)

Never going back there.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Fidelma Murphy
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Terrible service and customer care. They have my vehicle since Nov 24 waiting on a part. Every time I ring up I get a different excuse as to why the ETA is pushed out. My employee went today to remove some items from the vehicle and received nothing but abuse from an older man, yelling and screaming at her when all she was doing is her job. He was angry because no one told him she was coming even though I called last week, then he proceeded to yell and scream because he could not locate the keys. I wonder if my employee was male would he have received the same treatment.
This is shocking and very upsetting and is not acceptable to receive this kind of treatment.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Joe Habib
user_reviews_extended.Description:
People great.
Serice great but No communication once you leave‚Ä¶ I needed to keep calling and chasing to see the progress of the repair. They had the LDV over a week and I would have like a call or any information of the progress which I never received.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Dejan Stanchevski
user_reviews_extended.Description: I have been to many services, but I have never encountered such unprofessional service ANYWHERE. I picked up the vehicle from the service today with the wrong mileage in my service book, with the vehicle not checked at all, they charged me for the services, in fact, they forced me to change the discs and pads without any need, which I had already checked at another mechanic. I am afraid that the oil and filters have not been changed. I do not recommend the service here.

user_reviews_extended.Name: HUIYAN ZHANG
user_reviews_extended.Description: Purchased an MG ZST from Parramatta MG and had an excellent experience with Deepika. She provided outstanding service‚Äîthorough, reliable, and incredibly patient throughout the entire process. Truly appreciate her support and guidance. Thank you, Deepika!

user_reviews_extended.Name: ayse
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Excellent and great customer service, I was helped by Tamera such a wonderful person. Helped me through my service appointment and equipped me
with all the information i needed to know such as what type of service, regular or major. This service I got a regular service for my mg 22‚Äô. She and the service team ensured what will be looked into and given me a rough price and ensured all my questions and if there is any problems from my vehicle from my end. All was cleared lovely people. Thank you Mg and LDV team.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Fran
user_reviews_extended.Description: LDV Homebush West, has the worst service. Would not recommend servicing your car here, nobody calls you back. We've been waiting over 3 months to get our car back aswell, if we dont call for an update, nobody calls you. Very disappointing, i'd recommend you to go to the actual place in person and fix it in person, so then they might actually listen to you instead of bloody not calling you back or not giving you updates.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Young Kim
user_reviews_extended.Description: I was assigned to your service center because of my car recall, and you said you could visit me in three days, but I've been spending more than $1,500 on car rentals for 12 days. Is this right? I'll report it to fair trading.

user_reviews_extended.Name: M C
user_reviews_extended.Description: Had a great experience with the team repairing my MG under warranty, they communicated clearly and fixed my car in just a few days, Ethan was great, highly recommend the  Homebush service centre, thanks again :)

user_reviews_extended.Name: Samir Panjsheri
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Extremely Disappointed ‚Äì Feels Like a Scam!

I recently took my two-year-old vehicle to MG Service Group in Homebush for servicing, and the experience has been nothing short of frustrating. My car is used for short drives, and the brakes were working perfectly fine before the service. However, after the service, they gave me a quote of $733 stating that the brake pads and discs needed replacement. I was advised  to make booking in couple of months  however the brakes started making a loud squeaking sound right after couple of weeks.

This felt suspicious, so I checked Google reviews and was shocked to see that many other customers had experienced similar issues. It seems like a pattern where perfectly fine brakes suddenly need replacement after being ‚Äúserviced‚Äù here.

I have other vehicles and have never had to replace brake pads and discs this early despite  driving it recklessly ‚Äîlet alone within two years of normal use! I can‚Äôt shake the feeling that this is more about upselling unnecessary repairs than providing genuine service.

I strongly urge others to do their research and think twice before trusting this place with your vehicle. My experience has been extremely disappointing, and I would not recommend MG Service Group Homebush to anyone. I would like to see customers to take this matter to consumer affairs

user_reviews_extended.Name: Kel Mitchell
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I dont write negative reviews. But this place needs one.
Dont ever, ever, come here. Take your buisness literally anywhere else.

1. First, they dont answer the phone. We called more than daily for over a week, leaving messages, they never called back.
2. They ordered me a part (because I turned up in person to organise it!) and couldn't tell me what colour it was going to be - like, how hard is it to know that?
3. They leave a message saying to come and get the part ASAP. But I had booked them to install it. I could not get them to call me back to see if they had booked me in for real or not.
4. I turned up again, in person, to pick up the part and take it somewhere else to be installed.
5. I spoke to one nice human, named Darren. The older man who was there was yelling at him, telling him off, and being rude to him, and was just awful. Poor Darren, you deserve better!

Take your buisness literally anywhere else. I swear these five star reviews can't be real.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Richard Forte
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Had my tow bar installed today after having purchased my mg zst core on 15th january, 2025.
It was on back order. The team in service including Binal and Jennifer and the whole service team and process was very professional courteous and friendly....can't recommend highly enough.....my bike rack crossbar was not fitted as requested but probably my fault that I didn't mention it to Binal. Otherwise 1st class guys...give yourselves a pat on the back.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Joe S
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Not even worth the 1 star. Disgusting people and disgusting service to deal with. I have a MG that‚Äôs practically new. The car presented issues with barely 1000kms. From the get go Sophie was horrible to deal with starting with the way she addresses a customer and the way she handled my issues acting like a know it all and trying to make me look stupid. They lied to me regarding fixing the car where it wasn‚Äôt fixed, they just said that to get me to pick up the car, however upon checking the paperwork it shows that the part is pending approval from MG Australia, so not only filthy service but liars as well.
Then I thought speaking with the manager would make anything better but Ricky decided to go Casper the Ghost and dodge all my phone calls. Yes MG is a cheap car but this doesn‚Äôt mean the service has to be cheap and disgusting. Shame on you. Given that this is a brand new car it does not portray any reliability or safety to not only myself but my family as well.

QUICK UPDATE: the car was taken to Lansvale MG where they actually know how to treat humans and diagnosed my car properly and had it fixed.

user_reviews_extended.Name: George beltsos
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Terrible service
They had van in for 5 days to fix a hose leak and do a service
They rang told me said it‚Äôs ready only to find out once I went to pick it up that they haven‚Äôt serviced it after being told 3 times it needs a service.
Had to wait almost 2 hours while they serviced it
I Won‚Äôt be coming back

user_reviews_extended.Name: Hiep Nguyen
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I have order the timing bell almost more than 3 months and it‚Äôs still been waited orders.
I went to service department last week for replacing Alternator which dont know why it‚Äôs broken while my van just 1 year old with 20k km.
And then this morning, 1 week following when replacements alternator, my van shows up the coolant level low.
I opened the front engine to check and very astonishing because the coolant cap was missing. Im looking around and found it just near the corner.
I cant believe how the staff could forget to close back that, that is imbecility and un-reasonably when they do their job.

Also i lost 2 the hub cap tyre and they refused that they forget to put back and said may fall off when i was the road.
So disappointed‚Ä¶

user_reviews_extended.Name: Hightower Mark
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I have owned an LDV D90 since 2018 and prior to that a Great Wall X240 - although I live on the Northern Beaches I am happy to travel to Homebush to get my car serviced, principally because of the excellent service I receive from Jamie and his team. The car now has over 130,000 km on it and has never had an issue - I put this down to the quality of the service I have received

Update May 2025 - Once again Jamie and his team were more than helpful in diagnosing a minor issue and getting me back on the road. Very happy to recommend the Homebush Service Centre team.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Josephine H
user_reviews_extended.Description: Online Booking form does not work - there is no response to my enquiry to book a normal annual service in. We have tried calling multiple times over the last 2 weeks, and no one picks up the phone. We have also tried using the online chat box and emailed them to follow up on our enquiry, and was still not able to make a booking. Very disappointing.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Giuseppe Pagano
user_reviews_extended.Description: Worst customer service ever . Unprofessional from the way they treat customers, handle and deal with problems ( literally they don‚Äôt care  at all .. I wish they would ) . They don‚Äôt let you understand the procedure , not formal quote is released , not even an email to an explanation of the process or how the follow up is done for the assessment of your car so it is just a lottery ticket where no one knows what‚Äôs going on and you wish that luck kindly kissing you . Then since there is not professional care the trust to fix your car goes down to south and it is actually the case . We had our Car broke down at blacktown and towed it away to this car service centre which i highly recommend to everyone for own peace and best interest  to steer away ( as many other poor reviews also highlighted  I wish I would know before so I would  avoid this nightmare and would  bring somewhere else . Anyway a technician from roadside assistance that helped us to remove the car from the driveway , detecting that was an issue related with ECU as the computer system was failing the connect hence was flashing all the lights ( a things that was already starting a while ago but the car was still functioning as well a  the technician from previous  car service that serviced the car literally 2 months before was mentioning that system need to be reviewed from MG authorized dealer ) but those so called experts from this car shop insisted that was the battery with low voltage which  for a car brand new with only 2 years and 8 months would be quite unreasonable and unjustifiable so  they  asked me to pay over $300 to get fixed as warranty was not covered ( although initially one of their mechanic was also saying shouldn‚Äôt be the battery as the car is brand new and only 19000 kms ). As I couldn‚Äôt afford to stay without car and have a little kid to drop at school I was kindly ask a car replacement for the time of fixing and I was rejected . Then with no option left I asked to get fixed and to pay but to review the entire car and the ECU system which I was reassured that was fine . As I wouldn‚Äôt trust them due the lack of communication and professionalism from the day I visited this shop and literally from everyone .. the issue was around the corner .. we have picked up the car , my partner with kid drove away and after an hour the car start to flash all the lights again and the steer wheel getting hard and break pad stiff ( could be also very dangerous) . It happened exactly what I was worried . Then email , email and again email back and forth with phone call and no reply was sent . Spoke to the receptionist that informed me that manager in 10 mins will contact you..  . Still waiting and Not sure how many 10 minutes have passed ever since . So for your own peace , respect , time and money stay away from this people ! Those businesses Are just leeching and want only your money . As you can read from other reviews they are just a disgrace and don‚Äôt deserve any business with anyone . Not sure how MG still let them operate .

user_reviews_extended.Name: johnny loi
user_reviews_extended.Description: They dont care at all...something can be avoided...but they choose to ignored and cause so much trouble for everyone else. Purchase and change car becos of the this service center.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Greg
user_reviews_extended.Description: NOT RECOMMENDED at all, what the heck is this type of service? They dont even call you back. dont even bother to call, just talk to a lawyer or go to the actual place and have some fun, because this is not fair at all, the service is disgusting and poor as you can clearly see in the reviews, most o them talk about the bad service, it really feels like a scam and its honestly bad

user_reviews_extended.Name: Nat Han
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Very poor service.
Lack of EV knowledge.

Staff working there had no idea what the issue was with my EV vehicle and why it could not charge.

I showed them the front charger and the issue, and the staff looked at it clueless and said oh this might be a big issue and we cannot handle it and you might need to change the part which is a major repairs.

I mentioned my EV could not charge after they half upgraded the vehicle software on their first service and I had to rebook to upgrade the software again and escalate the issue.

Only to be told by their servicing staff that MG now restricted all MG EV cannot use ANY supercharges and must purchase their MG charging cable in order to charge. I never mentioned anything aboutTesla but their staff kept mentioning Tesla (presuming that there are only Tesla charges in Sydney and no other charging stations like BP or Ampol,) and saying only MG EV owners can only charge their EVs using their MG charging cable.
I asked them when this happened and no staff could give me any answer and just said they were told this from head office to let their customers know to buy their exclusive MG EV charging cable.

This is ridiculous as the charge plug is universal Type 2 which all charge stations can support.
And what is even more crazy is BP and AMPOL charging stations already have their cables built in so you cannot use MG cables to plug into it anyways.

It was clearly a software issue as the night before first servicing, I was able to charge. But after the first servicing, I could not longer charge at any charging station, hence why I had to urgently book again for another service.
Only to be told at the second service that I must buy the MG exclusive charging cable.

After I collected my MG EV, I went to a BP supercharger to test their theory and guess what?‚Ä¶it was charging perfectly fine and fully charged.

So this clearly indicated it was a software issue from their end and the incompetency of the service center staff at this centre with absolutely had no idea of servicing EVs.
The experience felt like it was their first time being exposed to EV technology and and just made up excuses not to resolve the issue clearly.

Do not recommend any vehicle owners who bought MG EVs to service their vehicles at his service centre.

Disappointing.

user_reviews_extended.Name: ÂæêÂª∫Êòé
user_reviews_extended.Description: Shit service no one pick up the phone whole day. My wife went and been told no need to do service which already overdue. The recipient never check records properly!!! Wast of time!!!

user_reviews_extended.Name: Mukul chhabra
user_reviews_extended.Description: Pathetic services never go to their centre lady sofie is so rude so unprofessional using abusive language over the phone I don‚Äôt know who has given her a job in a ldv service centre even the manager Rickey their does not listen to anything very unprofessional people working in ldv management soon take action otherwise they will screw all the customers

user_reviews_extended.Name: Maria Palomar
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I wanted to share another update about my experience with the team at Homebush LDV and MG - Service, Parts, and Accessories Centre, following today's service. Three weeks ago, I brought my car in for a 20,000km service and had already left a 5-star review for that excellent experience. This week, I returned for a timing belt replacement scheduled for Tuesday. Despite taking a couple of days, I sincerely appreciate the team's thorough inspection of my vehicle from start to finish.

Special thanks to the service personnel who arrived early this morning to conduct a road test, ensuring my car was ready for pickup before my workday began. I must commend the team for their consistent and attentive customer service, even during their ridiculously busy periods. Their dedication is truly commendable.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Morris Saric
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Great service from the moment I dropped my Kia for a log book service.
The reception area worked as a team.
Sophie,Tamara and Bida made sure I received updates and I was able to grab a coffee.
The showroom was clean and when the Kia was ready,James and Micheal told me to enjoy the day.
Such a happy place.

user_reviews_extended.Name: sim
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Never answer the phone.

Terrible customer service.

They‚Äôve had my car for a month and no call back nothing.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Madeleine Haddad
user_reviews_extended.Description: LDV Representative - Ethan was lovely to deal with and helped myself and my mother with the service / parts for her LDV. Great experience.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Sandy Ma
user_reviews_extended.Description:
On 7th June 2024 I had the regular car service in Homebush centre. The service report indicated that everything is good. However, before and after car service, I've noticed squeaking noises supposedly coming from the brakes during driving. So, I contact again about this issue after car service and took my car to Homebush centre again.

05 Aug 2024, Homebush centre told me that the front discs and pads need urgent replacement. This is astonishing and unbelievable because between the last service and this service, I've only driven around 1300 kilometres, it is impossible the brakes would worn out so fast if the report from the last service indicated that the brakes are alright. I asked them if the brakes were okay 2 months ago but now it needs urgent replacement after 2 months, they said "yes". They literally treat their customers as fools.

Homebush centre quoted me $733 to replace the disc. It is really crazy expensive price. I paid only $450 in another auto repair shop to had my brakes replaced. I have strong reasons to believe that MG Homebush centre did not check my vehicle properly. They only took money from me but did not do their job. brakes are very important and might cause serious accident and I might lost my life. I am very angry with their bad service.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Mohammad Akbar Pasha
user_reviews_extended.Description: I went for general service and the staff at LDV Homebush is really helpful and the manager Jamie Procopio is an awesome manager. Definitely recommend others. Thanks

user_reviews_extended.Name: Danny Tan
user_reviews_extended.Description: Absolutely applauding service. my MG car was towed to them on Monday and since, I didn't receive any call or email of acknowledgment. When I relentlessly called to find out the status of my car, the male receptionist told me in word of the following effect : " we are very busy and we have 7 cars towed in daily, we will get back to you when we can." such unprofessional attitude and such arrogant attitude when dealing with worrying car owner. No update, no acknowledgement, no progression report, absolutely nothing! I am seriously regretting to even brought such a lemon. Highly unhappy customer. won't recommend to anyone buying MG or LDV, unless you want to experience premature heart attack from post sale treatment.

user_reviews_extended.Name: khushbu prajapati
user_reviews_extended.Description:
That's really frustrating! I bought the LDV D90 last year because it had great features and was spacious. But before my first service, a part on the back side came out. During the first service, I mentioned the issue to the service provider, and they said they would organize the car part for me. I was expecting a call, but they never got back to me. After a few months, I called and asked about the part, and they said they had received it. Such bad service!

Yesterday, when I booked my car to get the part fixed, they told me I had to keep my car there for the whole day. They had initially said it would only take an hour. I couldn't stay the whole day because I had no other way to get home. At the service center, a person named Kris said they would call and book my car for the part fix. But yesterday passed, and I haven't received any call or message from the service center.

I don't think I should recommend LDV to anyone else. If the service center treats existing customers like this, I wonder how they would serve new customers. It's disappointing.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Farhatulla khan Mohammed
user_reviews_extended.Description: Beat service centre  Jamie is  very helpfull highly recommended

user_reviews_extended.Name: Mohamed alhiriz
user_reviews_extended.Description: Mohamed is a ROCKSTAR service adviser! He's always so friendly, knowledgeable, and patient when helping me with my issues. His expertise is unmatched and he takes the time to explain everything in a way that's easy to understand. Mohamed truly cares about his customers and it shows in the exceptional service he provides. I've never felt rushed or like I'm bothering him, even when I've had multiple questions. He's a true asset to the team and I'm so grateful to have him as my go-to service adviser! 5 stars isn't enough - I'd give him 10 stars if I could!

user_reviews_extended.Name: Mirko V
user_reviews_extended.Description:
You would have a better chance of Donald Trump picking up the phone than these guys.
Been calling them for weeks and yet no answer or a follow up.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Kris K
user_reviews_extended.Description: Ricky and this dealership are completely unprofessional. We have been trying to get our MG3 in for its 10,000 km service for MONTHS and keep getting stuffed around - oh we'll call you back etc etc. Finally losing our minds we try one last time , now it's going to be 3 weeks away despite numerous promises to be called back and to fit us in acknowledging the royal stuff around we have been given. Avoid this service centre and avoid the unprofessional and dismissive attitude of Ricky and his team. FYI Ricky is the service manager and clearly doesn't understand what service means.

user_reviews_extended.Name: sujit prajapati
user_reviews_extended.Description:
No arrangements for weekend
No arrangements for parking
No time frame for vehicle service even mentioned your situation.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Smitha
user_reviews_extended.Description:
frustrating experience at Homebush LDV service center.

I have been waiting for a part for my vehicle for over two months. Despite numerous follow-ups via email and phone calls, I received no updates .Finally, after being informed that the part had arrived, I booked a service appointment two weeks in advance, with a confirmed booking for 30/08/24

On the day of the appointment, I took time off work and arrived at the service center at 8 am, expecting a smooth process. However, I was shocked when the customer service representative, Mohammed, informed me that he needed to check if the part was available before proceeding with my booking. After checking, he informed me that the part was still not ready to be fixed and that I would be contacted once it ready.

This experience was not only inconvenient but also highly unprofessional. The lack of communication, incorrect information, and disregard for customers time are unacceptable.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Maria Teresa Palomar
user_reviews_extended.Description: Came in for my 20,000km service today for my LDV T60 Max, from the beginning to the very end was smooth and seamless. I was given a very clear time frame of roughly 4hrs for the service from the start (longer than usual due to complimentary EMS upgrade)  and recommendations on near by cafes, as I was gonna be waiting around. I decided to visit Sydney Market Cafe up the road, roughly 5 minute walk from the service centre and serves amazing Coffee! After an hour I came back down to wait in the service centre for another 2.5hrs, I asked for the progress of my service and was well informed of the progress and a gasket leak found, which was being attended to already and covered under LDV‚Äôs reliable warranty as well. I was provided an iPhone charger when I asked and a nice sitting area to plug it in; great for those that need to  work/ study while car is serviced. 30-45 minutes later I was called to the front desk to let me know my service was complete, and told my timing belt needed to be replaced again covered under LDV‚Äôs reliable warranty, so I was diligently booked in on the spot for 3 weeks from now with a confirmation message sent through almost immediately; as that‚Äôs how long parts take to arrive, I was told I would need to leave the car for 2 days and was offered to have a loan car arranged for me. This is my second time getting my car serviced and it‚Äôs been nothing but smooth sailing, the team there is incredibly reliable and honest people. Can‚Äôt recommend them enough!

user_reviews_extended.Name: Francesco
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Got my car over for a light bulb change, waited almost an hour and my car was ready earlier but none of the staff bothered telling me so I had to ask twice.
The guy at reception was extremely rude and careless as he saw me waiting to be able to talk to him while he was on the phone but suddenly he served a customer that had just walked in, how rude!
Furthermore the mechanics left some loose parts inside my car‚Äôs bonnet that I found a week later.
WILL NEVER STEP FOOT IN THERE AGAIN!
Your customer service sucks.

user_reviews_extended.Name: shaffan naeem
user_reviews_extended.Description:
My car had a transmission fault alarm while driving on the highway, so I contacted MG, which directed me to Roadside Assist. Roadside Assist advised against driving due to safety concerns and towed my car to the this MG service centre. However, despite keeping my car for four days, MG service claimed they couldn't find any issues and simply advised me to monitor it.
Just a week later, my MG Pilot system malfunctioned while driving, followed by other system failures. I brought my car to MG again. Despite keeping my car for an additional two days, they still couldn't identify any problems. To add insult to injury, they warned me that if I brought my car in again without a clear issue, I'd be charged.
The mechanics even asked me to record a video of the faulty system for evidence, like I should take out my phone and record a video - while driving! After realising it was an absurd suggestion, he said that I need to have someone accompany me while driving to capture the error. So according to him, I need to arrange for someone to drive with me every single time to wait for the error to happen! Totally irresponsible and incompetent customer service!

user_reviews_extended.Name: hitechhu mehta
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I arrived at MG Homebush Service Centre for my first scheduled service appointment for my MG3 on March 7, 2024, at 9:00 am. Before my service day, I had reported a noise coming from the dashboard over the phone. Upon arrival, a technician or quality department staff member joined me in the car for a road test to diagnose the noise. After confirming the issue, they assured me it would be fixed by 2:00 PM, along with the normal service.

However, when I returned to collect the car after receiving a message around 2:15 PM that my car was ready for collection, I found it had not been washed. When I asked, they apologized and explained that the car washer was broken, which I understood. Despite being informed that the issue was resolved, the noise persisted. I immediately returned, and the same technician from the morning joined me on another road test and confirmed that nothing had been done to address the noise.

I raised the issue with the reception, and they consulted with the technician who had worked on my car, confirming that no post-repair checks had been carried out. Despite this, I had been called to collect the car, even though the noise was still present, and the paperwork incorrectly stated that all issues had been resolved. Upon my request, they updated the paperwork to reflect the ongoing problem.

This experience was frustrating as it wasted my time and day off, especially since I had taken the day off for servicing, considering they are not open on weekends. I am disappointed with their customer service; they should have informed me that my car might need a few more days to be fixed instead of calling me to collect it when the problem was not fixed.

user_reviews_extended.Name: sashi shrestha
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I have requested to change my usb port from last 8months. Driving my 2022 ZST essence without the tab and map.
Which comes under 7 years warranty .
The Homebush, Sydney team hasn‚Äôt even followed up once in last 8 months period.
Really not happy with the service which they are providing.
I have lost my patience.
Someone should really take care of this.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Gagan sharma
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I had my MG ZST serviced on March 8, 2024, marking my first service since purchasing the car in July 2023. Unfortunately, it was one of the worst service experiences I've had. Upon arrival, I mentioned an issue with my car's cruise control, only to be met with dismissive remarks from the staff. Their response, 'don't expect anything special as it's Friday and we don't have much staff,' left me deeply disappointed. If staffing is an issue, why accept service bookings?

Additionally, I pointed out that the back left NSR door trim was coming off and requested it be checked. However, I was immediately accused of breaking it and told it wasn't covered under warranty. I explained that I noticed it six months ago, just three months after purchasing the car, suggesting it may have been a pre-existing condition. Despite this, I was informed that I would need to pay for the parts and schedule another service day for the repair, as the door was allegedly not covered under warranty.

Furthermore, when I requested a car wash, I was informed that the facility was suddenly broken that morning. It seems implausible that the car wash would break just as I arrived at 8:05 AM. Additionally, despite the servicing, they failed to reset the service kilometers in my car, resulting in me still receiving notifications for the 10,000 kilometers service being due. This lack of attention to detail is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the professionalism of the servicing team.

If I have the option to return my car, I would gladly do so after such a disappointing experience with the servicing team. It's disheartening to receive such poor treatment, especially considering the trust and investment I've placed in MG as a brand.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Wassim Dandan
user_reviews_extended.Description: Terrible customer service it‚Äôs been over 6 months since I reported my cars issue and it‚Äôs yet to be resolved

user_reviews_extended.Name: Raju Bhavana
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Poor customer service, rude staff, as if you made a mistake if you bought an MG because they are the cheapest cars in the market.

I gave my MG ZST Essence for 40k service here, Worst experience, they didn't bother to repair or inform me anything. I gave multiple calls to them with long wait times and Finally, they said, come quickly to collect it, moreover, its closing time, anything come tomorrow but pay the money now. I can certainly say they didn't do the job after receiving my vehicle.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Robert Simmons
user_reviews_extended.Description: I dropped in to get a new tail light globe replaced. The lady at the counter was very polite and helpful. I had the job done while I waited. I didn‚Äôt have to book it in which was awesome! Only cost $28. Very satisfied. Just a bit of a weird procedure at the end after I paid getting my car keys and car back. Never the less I am very satisfied. Thank you!

user_reviews_extended.Name: Zahin Ahmed
user_reviews_extended.Description: Unprofessional irresponsible individuals work here and misguide customers with the help of their corporate office. user_reviews_extended.Name: ehsan vossough
user_reviews_extended.Description: They did a great job with replacing my Tail lights and checking the charger...

user_reviews_extended.Description:

user_reviews_extended.Name: Pranav Jakkamputi
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Really very very bad customer service

Today my friend took my car to service, morning they called me said, we are recommending to change Air conditioning treatment and fuel filters replacement, I asked them how it cost, they said $130 change each, total around $260. And they sent a link to approve them, in that they mentioned only Air conditioning treatments with higher price $210, I declined that. When they hand overing they asked me to pay $270 for only fuel filter replacement and they didn't do Air conditioning treatment because they said I rejected in the link. I told them that I didn't accept this also how can you charge for this, I will pay only $130 as they mentioned over phone.

Now they are telling the person who called me about this treatment is outsider, she mentioned that $270 is the price for the treatment, can give the phone to the lady spoken to me, they said she is not belong to the service centre, then I asked, how she got my number  to call me and how you are accepting her words if she is not  belongs to your service centre.

They said if you pay full amount only we will hand over the car which is very bad behaviour from this service centre, I am lodging complaint on this issue on fair trade has they are telling wrong amount and charging higher amount.

Now I am thinking that really they replaced oil filters or  simply charging with out  replaced. How we need to believe this people.

Really very very bad customer service

user_reviews_extended.Name: Daniyal haider khan
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Very poor customer service and misleading communication from staff just to get you off their backs. First they don't order all the parts and charge you for the loan car, they will ask you to come to collect the car by saying it is ready for pick up once you go there they say they ordered the parts and it will take few weeks then I will have to come and pay for the loan car again which is ridiculous I just did't pay for the loan car fuel and fee for them to diagnose when I already told them what the issue was with the parts which was visible as well. I notified there frustrated salesperson Nicholas that not all the parts are ordered and he told me that he will take pictures and order it later just to get rid of me. After that I called them twice on 2 different days and they said they did not order the part and someone will get back to me. This whole experience has been frustrating. Very poor communication internally.

Update 04.04.2024:
I posted my review almost 2 months ago, today is 04.04.2024. I spoke to their manager Danny during these 2 months,  he pretended that he cared and promised that he will give me a call back by the end of day which was 2 weeks ago, I believe his days are longer than mine, still waiting for the phone call. I wish I had another MG service center nearby so I never had to go back to this terrible service center again.

Update 21.05.2024:
I called them again almost 2 weeks ago and I was advised that the part arrived in March but nobody gave me a call and then they did exactly what they do, started blaming different departments. I asked to speak to the manager but I was told asked to send an email and I am still waiting for a response.

Update 10.06.2024:
I still have not received any response, I have also emailed MG in which I cc'd the customer care, manager 'Deni' and 'Nina' and advised them about the complaint that I have made to fair trade Nsw but MG still have not responded.

Update 14.06.2024:
I was contacted by fair trade, I explained them about the whole scenario, after fair trade contacted them I received a phone call on the same day from their manager Deni, I believe they don't take you seriously unless you get fair trade involved. I booked my car for 27.06.2024 thinking that both the issues will be fixed (how silly of me), I received a call from them saying it is ready for pick up, once I picked it up I noticed that they only fixed one issue, Muhammed was the representative I was dealing with. He said that it will take 15-20 mins to get it sorted but I had to go back to work. I was told when I will come back for my first service they will fix it and provide a loan car.

Update 27.09.2024:
I booked my car for service and loan car was not available so I was like as long as my car gets fixed I will ignore the fact that I am not getting a loan car, but as always they have the worst work ethics and customer service. I dropped my car at 8:15am and I did not receive a call regarding my car if it is ready or not. I had to call at 3pm and I was advised that I will receive a call from Muhammad who was busy. I was worried that I might not have my car for the weekend as till 4:15pm I did not receive a call, I had to call and the person at customer service said that my car was ready and they are short staffed which is why they could not call, I only had 45mins to reach the service centre. I went to the service centre and guess what the issue was still not resolved, this time he said the part they ordered was broken and for my carplay issue he advised to buy an apple data transfer cable. Now I will need to go back for the fourth time to fix a minor issue. I still don't know how they are running this business or if nobody cares about this service centre.

I keep on updating my review so nobody else has to go through what I am going through. Their management is as inexperienced as their staff.

Booked my MG for the first service, worst communication to get any confirmation on it. To add, after finishing service, no call to confirm if the car is ready for Pick up. I did reach on time only to find that car's issue has not been resolved and it drives the same even after paying for the service.

Not going back every again.

Please Treat your customers with respect and empathy. And it's OK to make mistakes (when you say you will call when car is ready, call me) please acknowledge and empathise with your customers.

Thank you. I'll take my business (small as it may be for you) elsewhere.

user_reviews_extended.Name: El-azzi Charbel
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Put my car in for service and to fix a problem when car is in a tight turning circle, it vibrates.
So booked in 2 weeks in advance to get early spot 7.30am with estimated finish time 10.30 t0 11am for a 5000 km/6 month service.
Dropped car off night before to avoid traffic, not being local to area.
Mind you it's only done 2800km getting  service done esrly because tnis turning circle thing was annoying me so just do both same time.
So get a email saying, it's a wheel alignment issue and it'll $90.00 to repair. Skeptical at 1st because I didn't think it was, but hey easy fix and cheap  there charging $383.00 for essentially an oil change, whats an extra 90.. I did ask please get the technician to drive once completed to make sure it was the issue.
Get a text 2.49 pm yesterday cars ready, I was  assured it was taken for a text drive and problem re solved.
Pick up car this morning, 1st full circle, long behold problem still there.
So two stars purely for the fact I was clearly mislead and now I have to go through this process all again with my local ldv depo, who I should probli taken to in 1st place, but I stupidly listened to salesman Michael from Five dock where I purchased the vehicle who insisted that at least 1st service get done here.
People in office were professional enough, and im sure the scheduled service was done well, but i still got an annoying issue apart from the odd electrical faults in this brand new car. But hey I guess can be exected when you buy cheap(37,000 compared to other msked),  but the being lied to and treated like an idiot, yeh no thanks

user_reviews_extended.Name: Tharindu Buddhika Adhikari
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I recently had the pleasure of experiencing top-notch service at Homebush LDV and MG's Service, Parts, and Accessories Centre for my MG car, and I can't express enough how satisfied I am with the entire process.

First and foremost, I'd like to extend my deepest appreciation to the entire team at Homebush LDV and MG, who went above and beyond in ensuring that my car was not only taken care of promptly but also with the utmost professionalism and attention to detail.

A special shout-out to the phenomenal Advisor, Derren Clay, whose exceptional customer service skills truly set the bar high. Derren not only exhibited an in-depth understanding of my car's needs but also ran the extra mile to ensure that all faulty parts were replaced promptly under warranty, resulting in zero out-of-pocket expenses for me.

Derren's friendly demeanor and commitment to delivering outstanding service made the entire experience seamless and stress-free. His ability to complete all the necessary jobs in such a short time was truly remarkable, reflecting the efficiency and expertise of the entire team at Homebush LDV and MG.

I highly recommend Homebush LDV and MG's Service, Parts, and Accessories Centre to anyone in need of exceptional service for their vehicles. The team's dedication to customer satisfaction, coupled with their proficiency in handling warranty issues, makes them stand out in the automotive service industry.

Thank you once again to Derren Clay and the entire team at Homebush LDV and MG for exceeding my expectations. Your commitment to excellence has earned you a loyal customer, and I will undoubtedly be recommending your services to friends and family.

Keep up the fantastic work!

We dropped off one of our 4 month old LDV vans for a warranty issue after our fleet mechanic raised an issue regarding the noise coming from the front wheels. Every time we called to ask for an ETA or update, we got no call back. When we did finally get a text to pick up the van we were told we needed to pay, as the issue was related to noise from tools and equipment in the back of the van, even though we took the mechanic for a test drive where he admitted he could hear the noise coming from the front wheels. Our mechanic had the van on a hoist prior to taking it to LDV and spun the wheels by hand and you can hear the noise.
I was at the start of replacing our fleet of about 25 vans with LDVs. I've purchased 7 new LDV's but I'm not moving forward with any more until I feel that LDV can offer a reliable & honest after sales and warranty service. This experience was not it.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Lee Burnett
user_reviews_extended.Description: After dealing with Ldv Parramatta on atleast 4 occasions my experience was totally disgraceful with there service of my G10 especially the last one,first time I went they wanted the van at 12pm for the service I got a phone call at 3.30pm to pick it up they close at 4pm)couldn't pickup until 8am next morning. The next service poor workmanship after finding out 2 weeks later that the nut at the bottom of oil sump was barely in,when oil filter changed the oil was all down the side of motor and not cleaned up.3rd bad experience 2 weeks prior to having a major problem I had booked in my van at Parramatta service centre and told them that I had a concern about loud rattling in the front that I suspect it was the timing chain,after 1 and a half days I picked it up with the service department telling me we can hear nothing and that it should be fine to drive.2 weeks later I had my van towed there after no exceleration and very loud rattle.I had contacted Parramatta service centre to tell them what happened and that they'll look at it tomorrow. 2 days later after several unanswered phone calls I went there in person to be told we will look inside the motor to find the problem but it will cost you $740 to look at it,I told them this is ridiculous ,I gave then the ok to look at it.After hounding them on 3 occasions about when I'll get it back they told me Friday week hopefully so I could go back to work.They told me that be i wasn't booked in thats why.I told them if you had of listen to me 2 weeks ago we probably wouldn't have this issue. They rang me Friday morning the same day I'm supposed to get the van back to tell me,timing chain needs replacing, pulley needs replacing and cover needs replacing at a cost of 4100 and 6-7 week wait for parts,sorry this not good enough to tell me this 10 days later....

user_reviews_extended.Name: Tony Whyte
user_reviews_extended.Description:
My 2020 LDV D90 Executive alternator failed whilst I was on holiday in Dee Why NSW. After dealing with LDV Roadside Assist, my vehicle was taken to LDV Brookvale and I received the most disgusting customer service I have ever received in my life. I then had my vehicle towed to LDV Parramatta as it was an emergency to get my vehicle on the road again. Jodi Reid and her team at LDV Parramatta were exceptional, took the time and effort to listen to my situation and went over and above their duties to ensure my vehicle was back on the road within 48 hours. I cannot thank Jodi and her team enough for all their efforts! Extremely highly recommend Parramatta Auto Centre - LDV & MG Service & Parts.
Cheers
Tony Whyte

user_reviews_extended.Description: The best MG/LDV Service Centre i came across. Strongly recommended.

A special mention to Michael and Hussein who managed to navigate a difficult situation for us, ensuring our family were able to have our car serviced this week. Thank you!

user_reviews_extended.Name: Joe Leung (JCP Electrical)
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I have owned my 2017 LDV G10 sparky van since brand new.

It had just done its 50Ks service.  You can see i don't drive that much & that's because it spends more time in the workshop than on the road!?

I have been taking my 2017 LDV G10 sparky van to LDV Parramatta Service Centre since new.  Actually since LDV Five Dock Service Centre closed up after my first service.  I found both service centres were professional & the staff there treat customers well.

Jamie, the service manager & Jodi, the service advisor are both excellent at their customer service.

I felt that Jodi was doing her best that she could but just overwhelmed by all the LDV product's continuous issues coming from customers.

In fact, from my experience, all the staffs that i have dealt with at all the LDVs had been satisfactory.

However, what is unsatisfactory is the quality of the LDV product itself.  Namely, my G10 sparky van.

I don't want to write an essay on it here but let's just said it has more issues within its three years of manufacturers warranty, than all the other cars that i have owned, combined!

I definitely got to see a lot of Jamie, that's for sure!

I used to have a 2011 Hyundai iLoad sparky van & that was the opposite of my current G10.  I had my G10 sparky van since new, it had been back for warranty issues & repairs more times than i can count with my fingers!

BTW, also, my G10 sparky started to rust too!  So much for quality!  I had to today spend $260 to get "The Touch-Up Guys" Adam, to fix up the rust repair & respray because of the poor design & quality of this LDV product.

I have no confidence in this LDV product (my G10).

As a matter of fact, i still have more issues with my current G10 that they told me were recified, when it was still under its three years manufacturer's warranty!

So to sum it up.  Customer service at LDVs are satisfactory.  The people working there are working on a uphill battle to serve the customers the best they could with a inferior LDV product.

So, four stars to the LDV customer service.

And one star for the actual LDV product itself.  "Cheap & nasty"!

Four stars plus one star equals five stars!  So if LDV would improve the quality of their product, then they would become five stars, if they kept their pricing competitive, that is!

Because of LDV, i almost had a divorce with my wife of 20 years plus because of her nagging me every single day about my poor purchase on this poor LDV product (my current G10 sparky van).

And also there is no capped priced servicing plan for it, so you know what!?

BTW, my wife drives a Toyota!  Oh what a feeling, Toyota!

Oh, i don't get that feeling with LDV!  In fact, it is the opposite!

Come on LDV!  Pull your socks up!  A sparky like me gave you guys a break (try), please as least give it your best shot!

BTW, because of this sour experience with LDV, i am never going to buy another LDV ever again & i have been telling everybody who wants to know what i think of my 2017 LDV G10, that it is not worth the pain & the stress & the headache & your marriage over a van!

Game over LDV!?

I feel sorry for all the people that works in LDV.  Especially in LDV Parramatta Service Centre.  To come to work everyday to hear more customer complaints on their LDVs, every single work day.

So, i have made it my mission to whenever someone asked me about my 2017 LDV G10, i will give them a thumbs down!

P.s. My reverse camera works when it feels like it!?  And the funny thing is, the senior service technician came to me in person & told me he personally fixed it, when it was within its manufacturer warranty, means there is more to the poor LDV product than the technician himself.

P.s.s. I don't know if i should laugh it off or cry!?

Honestly have had nothing but hassles with this company.
Our car has been stuffed around 3 times.

Then they booked the car in to be looked at they said it would be done on the day we booked in, once again it got to nearly closing time with NO contact. My partner had to call to be told oh nah it won‚Äôt be done today there‚Äôs no time (after already being told it would definitely be done when we dropped it off) so had to go pick it up and take back as he needed his car that afternoon. We book in once again for the issue to be fixed and told yep will definitely be done today, afternoon the latest. AGAIN it is not done. We live 25mins away so 50min round trip each time going there that‚Äôs not including peak hour traffic. Absolute joke, poor communication and obviously very poor time management. Once can be understandable but 3 times is just a joke, I won‚Äôt recommend to anyone!

user_reviews_extended.Name: Darcy
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Flew to this joint from Queensland, under the premise "only a little bit of surface rust underneath the tray mate" i was told on the phone, sent photos that showed the 2016 hilux to be in really good nick.
I've flown interstate and withdrawn the remainder of the money to be given to them in cash ($25,000)
He tells me he's worked for toyota for 20 years.(Jimmy)
Failed to mention any of this rust or at least show me this.
When i told Jimmy i've been mislead about the amount of rust there is on the car, he said "What do you expect, for me to get on the ground and take photos underneath the car and dirty my clean uniform?!" As if he isnt a car salesman and they don't know about this. Constantly saying "I don't know" just pleading negligence as if this isn't his job and wouldn't know about any of this"
His manager luckily refunded my $1000 deposit before i had to take it further.
The Hilux was a total rust bucket, and when i first rocked up before even seeing the car, Jimmy asked if i wanted to hand over the cash now, or test drive it first.
Buyer beware. As dodgy as they come.
Keep in mind, this guy had the audacity to say i was in the wrong for not getting an independent inspection after misleading me like this, are you guys not a car dealership?
This car was literally built in 2016, they've bought it at a rock bottom price in hopes they can flick it off to someone gullible.
If you see this Hilux 2016 4x4 auto, be very careful, as it has been relisted on carsales.
I would avoid this dealership at all cost.
And i'm sure they will make some sort of effort to have this review removed - a typical tactic of dodgy buisness owners.
By the way, they've resprayed the tray i'd assume the day before i arrived, could still smell it and was still a little bit sticky when lifting latches.
The clay was half way up the side of the radiator and halfway up the chassy consistently all throughout.
If you are going to try scam someone, at least half know what you are doing. I could easily pick bits of flaky rust off with my hand on multiple parts of the car.
Absolute joke, you should be reported to consumer affairs.
If anyone wants the photos of what he sent me vs the photos i took, message me privately.
**They keep having my honest review taken down by google somehow**

UPDATE on my warranty problem with car wise Kingswood.
After replacing all the idlers pulleys and alternator the bearing noise was still there.
Ended up being the spigot bearing and thrush bearing were completely stuffed.
So I replaced the whole clutch and new spigot bearing and the bearing noise has completely gone. So after getting told numerous times by car wise Kingswood that the noise was normal. They were WRONG and I was right .
It cost me a fair amount of my own money to fix what the warranty should have covered.
As I said don‚Äôt trust these people.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Meeting Point Thai Town
user_reviews_extended.Description:
18/07/2023

CAR WISE LDV,  Xceed autos Pty Ltd

Subject: Complaint Regarding LDV Bus Purchase and After-Sales Service

I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to express my utmost dissatisfaction with my recent experience purchasing an LDV Bus from your dealership and the subsequent handling of issues that arose shortly after the purchase.

On 23/06/2023, I purchased a brand new LDV Bus from your dealership. To my dismay, within one week of the purchase, the vehicle experienced a severe breakdown, rendering it inoperable. I immediately contacted your workshop and notified them of the issue, hoping for a swift resolution. However, the experience that followed has been nothing short of a nightmare.

The vehicle was taken to your workshop for repairs, but instead of resolving the issue, it appears that the vehicle suffered additional damage during the repair process. This is completely unacceptable and has caused significant inconvenience and financial burden to me. I expected a brand new vehicle to be reliable, and the current situation has shattered my confidence in the product and your after-sales service.

To make matters worse, your workshop seems unwilling to take responsibility for the damages caused and has suggested that I should take the vehicle back without it being adequately fixed. This is simply unacceptable, as I refuse to accept a faulty vehicle that can potentially cause more harm down the road. Moreover, I was informed that I would be charged for not taking the vehicle back, which is not only unfair but adds insult to injury.

Throughout this ordeal, the communication and response from your workshop and dealership have been extremely slow, leaving me in the dark about the status of my vehicle and the progress of the resolution process. This lack of responsiveness and accountability has only added to my frustration and disappointment.

I expect immediate action to be taken to rectify the situation. I demand that my LDV Bus be thoroughly inspected, repaired to an excellent working condition, and compensated for any additional damages caused during the repair process. Furthermore, I request a written assurance that such issues will not arise in the future and a clear explanation of how you plan to prevent such incidents.

I trust that you understand the gravity of this situation and will take the necessary steps to address my concerns promptly. I urge you to treat this matter with the utmost urgency to avoid further escalation.

If my concerns are not adequately addressed within a reasonable timeframe, I may have no choice but to seek legal assistance and share my negative experience with others, including on social media platforms and relevant consumer review websites.

user_reviews_extended.Name: Ryan Hughes
user_reviews_extended.Description: Shifty dealership straight up mislead me, on multiple occasions. They said the rego had 6 months left, it was 3. They said there was no damage, there was a chip in the windshield. They said they'd give me $4k for my trade in but on the day of the sale tried to wipe an entire $1k off. I held my ground and they honoured the price. Worst of all, I asked if the negotiated price inc Stamp Duty and transfer fees which Alastair said it did. Months later I found out it didnt and now I'm up for an unexpected $1k inc $126 in a late fee. The manager Sam admitted on the phone to me that Alastair made a mistake because he comes from the new car department and didn't know the difference in internal policy. But yet he refused to do the honourable thing and hasn't gotten back to me since I emailed a formal complaint a week ago. I have now submitted a complaint to ACCC. Avoid these dodgy guys at all costs.

They unlocked the van and said they would be with us in about 5mins while they sent the other customer on an T/D.. We left half an hour later after standing around waiting to be seen, the sales guys were just inside chatting with each other   and they then started serving another customer that just came in instead of us. Disappointing to say the least now we are buying from another dealership.

I contacted roadside assistance who replaced my battery. New battery died with in 8 day called roadside assistance who organised my Ute to be towed to the dealer I then contacted Carwise and spoke to Gerry the owner who organised a call back from the sales manager Shane who was great as always he assured me my ute will be looked at on Monday and if there is a issue they will fix it as  as give me a  me a loan car until my Ute is fixed. user_reviews_extended.Name: Diana Alexiou
user_reviews_extended.Description:
My name is Diana Alexiou and I have been going to LDV Carwise Mechanics at Penrith for 6 yrs.

Up until last year I was very happy.... but the last few years I noticed a lot of staff turnover which concerned me somewhat but just pushed it aside.

Due to severe cataracts I have been legally blind since February this year (2023) and not allowed to drive so on Thursday May 18th I had my car booked in for a service....I asked if one of the ladies would be kind enough to pick up my car and drop it off.

I then prepared a note in writing asking the mechanics if they could please do a service, replace the 2 mechanical parts I was asked to buy as a result of the Rats eating them off my motor (the mechanics showed me photos of the Rats nest several months earlier).....and clean the Rats nest.

When I received my car the young lady told me although they replaced the parts eaten by the Rats the light was still on (on the dashboard) saying there is still a problem. They suggested I should go to their Auto Electrician to further check why the light was still on.

I went to the electrician, and long story short discovered my car was overheating and the Rats nest was NOT cleaned ....the Electrician told me the rats nest was an easy clean (which he did) and he saw the literature I was given where the mechanics printed  off saying they did not have the correct equipment to clean the Rats nest.....THE ELECTRICIAN SAID THAT WAS A LIE.

The Electrician asked me to take the car back to him in a few weeks where he can spend more time checking why the light is still on.

When I got home I REALLY  noticed my car was overheating......I checked the water level and almost burned my face.....the car was empty of water.

The end result for this lengthy note is to say my car was NOT PROPERLY SERVICED ....the rats nest was not cleaned and the water was not replenished.

I AM EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED WITH LDV CARWISE
PENRITH and will never ever go there again.

user_reviews_extended.Description: Couldn't be more happier with Shane, Amiee and Matt for their time while buying our new D90. After having problems less where, the team at Penrith helped me get into new car as quick as they could. I would recommend Shane and team to anyone looking for a new car, you won't be disappointed. user_reviews_extended.Name: Dana Villiotis
user_reviews_extended.Description:
Whilst looking for my boyfriend's first ever car, I found a car at LDV that I instantly fell in love with. Everything looked amazing at face value and it was a huge upgrade from the car I had at the time. Despite my strong distrust for car dealerships, I had a good feeling and decided to take the leap. The dealer wouldn't allow my brother (a mechanic) to scan the car for any potential problems until a deposit was made. He also promised 3 months warranty if any problems did arise after purchase. With warranty as a safety net, I bought the car and was in love- until oil started leaking from the rocket gasket and the SRS light appeared on my dash.

"No problem", I thought. It has warranty. I took the car in and the men were more than happy to help. I drove away and mere days later, the car was leaking oil again and the SRS light had returned. So, I emailed the dealership and was met with a pathetic "your car is older than 10 years old, so the warranty is void. We repaired your car out of good will." Of course, after threatening to involve fair trading, LDV invited me to bring my car in for ANOTHER inspection and repair. This time they actually did their job- or so I thought.

Two weeks ago, my car was leaking puddles of oil. I rang my mechanic brother who urged me to go to the nearest mechanic I could find. The mechanic was astounded by what he saw. He regrettably informed me that whoever had done my last major service (of course, it was LDV) had screwed the cap too tightly on the oil filter, to the point where it had pierced the filter and it had now cracked, leaking large quantities of oil everywhere. If I had driven for 10 more minutes, he said my engine would have ran out of oil and imploded. Along with this, my rocket gasket cover had never been replaced, as LDV had ensured me. Instead, it had been temporarily sealed with silicone. How convenient that it was a temporary fix that would last just long enough that the promised 3 month warranty  would be voided by the time it became a problem. And, of course, bad things come in threes. That same day, I found out that LDV had never supplied me with a wheel lock key. The mechanic found this out as he was unable to remove my wheel to access my rocket gasket cover without it. I can't even say I was surprised with anything this mechanic was telling me.

Car dealerships have a horrible reputation for a reason. I will personally never trust any dealership again and I was stupid enough to do so in the first place. LDV sold a car that was a huge safety risk and tried to trick me out of repairing it by blaming the age of the car rather than their incompetence. As promised, fair trading will definitely be getting involved.

user_reviews_extended.Description:
Staff were helpful. after my designated driver fell ill they picked me up from the station to collect my vehicle. Above and beyond hence the three stars.

Post sales care factor was low, I requested some minor repairs be made per my inspection, one of them a warranty inspection. They said they'd organise it however when i picked it up they were not done, claiming the inspector has to say these things, I questioned why, " they have no stake" , I got the same answer .

He waived the official service manual in front of me saying it passed last service fine . tried to tell me the problem was standard wear and tear (internal chrome trim bubbling).

No instruction on using the vehicle, no instruction manual and already having a bad day, i left viewing not to recommend this company due to the sales person's attitude.

I had an extremely disappointing experience with LDV FIVE DOCK. After ordering five LDV Delivery7 vehicles on January 31 for our company‚Äîbased on our prior purchases‚Äîthe customer service completely deteriorated once the deal was closed. The salesperson, who was very friendly at first, became unresponsive, ignoring multiple calls, texts, and emails. I even had to call the main line, where I again faced deliberate neglect.

Furthermore, the delivery promises were repeatedly broken. Initially, we were given a delivery date that was missed, then faced sudden issues on pickup day with one vehicle, and ultimately only two vehicles were delivered. One of the delivered vehicles immediately exhibited quality problems, displaying faulty dashboard alerts and unusual noises.

This lack of accountability and after-sales support is unacceptable.  I wouldn‚Äôt recommend LDV FIVE DOCK to anyone‚Äîsave yourself the hassle and look elsewhere.

Apparently the dealership does its own due diligence for used cars - but thankfully I had my own trusted mechanic go and take a look at the car. user_reviews_extended.Name: sami mohieldin
user_reviews_extended.Description:
I recently purchased the LDV T60 Max Luxe, and I couldn't be happier with my choice! The performance is impressive, with a powerful engine that handles both city driving and off-road adventures seamlessly. The interior is spacious and comfortable, equipped with modern technology and user-friendly features. I particularly love the advanced safety features that give me peace of mind on the road.

Fuel efficiency is also a pleasant surprise, making it a great option for everyday use. Plus, the value for money is outstanding compared to other brands. Overall, I highly recommend the LDV T60 in any class to anyone in the market for a reliable and versatile ute. Great job, LDV!

And a huge shoutout to the sales team and Saad for such a caring and homelike feel and making sure i made the right decision. Make sure you visit the dealership !

user_reviews_extended.Description:
This has been the worst decision I've made‚Äîbuying this car and choosing this dealership. The service team has been absolutely hopeless, and above all, rude. My car has been sitting with them for over five weeks, and getting any kind of update is a nightmare. I have to email three to four times just to get a basic response, and all I hear back is, "We're still waiting for manager approval."
Completely unacceptable. There is zero accountability, no sense of urgency, and no respect for the customer‚Äôs¬†time¬†or¬†money.

To make matters worse, when I called today in frustration seeking someone at LDV Australia who could help, the response I received was both rude and dismissive. I was told, ‚ÄúYou can Google LDV Australia yourself and find the number.‚Äù This level of service is not only unprofessional but shows a complete disregard for the customer experience.

DO NOT PURCHASE ANY LDV.

This car is terrible, water pump blown at 15k kms. Ignition problems at 20k kms. Service team take 3-4months to replace parts under warranty. My case got escalated to the CEO of Australia and he advised he refuses to provide service. This man should step down and be Fired. I believe this Brand should not be allowed to trade in Australia and should be closed for good. What a terrible product and service!

user_reviews_extended.Name: Feleti 'Aho
user_reviews_extended.Description:
We recently had the pleasure of working with Patrick and Kush at LDV Parramatta and we cannot recommend them highly enough!

From the moment we walked onto the lot, Patrick greeted my husband and I with a warm smile and an impressive level of professionalism that immediately put us at ease.

What stood out most was his genuine desire to help us find the perfect vehicle that fit our family‚Äôs needs and budget. He took the time to listen to our preferences and offered insightful advice without any pressure. His extensive knowledge of the cars on the lot was evident, as he provided detailed information about the features and benefits of the model we were interested in.

Throughout the entire process, Patrick maintained transparent communication, ensuring we were informed every step of the way. He was patient and answered all our questions, no matter how trivial they seemed.

We also had the pleasure of working with Kush, Parramatta LDV‚Äôs finance broker who truly exceeded our expectations. From the very first interaction, his professionalism was evident. He took the time to understand our financial goals and provided tailored advice that was both insightful and practical.

What stood out most was his honesty and thoroughness in explaining complex financial concepts in a way that was easy to grasp. He was always available to answer our questions, no matter how trivial they seemed, which made us feel valued as a client.

His attention to detail and commitment to finding the best options for us resulted in an outstanding outcome. We felt supported throughout the entire finance process, and his proactive approach ensured that we were informed at every step. We would highly recommend Kush to anyone seeking financial guidance with LDV Parramatta.

Both Kush and Patrick‚Äôs dedication to customer satisfaction was clear. The blend of professionalism, expertise, and exceptional service truly sets them both apart.

If you're in the market for a vehicle, we highly recommend seeking out Patrick and Kush at LDV Parramatta. Their professionalism, expertise, and friendly demeanor make the car-buying experience enjoyable and stress-free. Thank you, Pat and Kush for making our car-buying journey an outstanding one!

From the moment I walked into the dealership, Nimo was incredibly welcoming, knowledgeable, and professional. Nimo was very honest and diligent to find me my G10 van with desired model and features like barn doors. He even helped me navigate financing options to find a plan that worked best for my budget.

The entire experience was seamless, from the test drive to signing the paperwork. I highly recommend working with Nimo at LDV Parramatta.

user_reviews_extended.Description:
We purchased our LDV Delivery 9 in 2021 We also purchased extras as you do on new vehicles.
We ask for ceramic coating even paid for it. We dropped the van off twice to for the job to be completed. As a company we had to hire a van on both occasions so we could continue our work and both times we left our vehicle there it never got done!
They promised they would send someone out to complete the job. We never heard from them.i called on so many occasions over the months and years only to be promised I would get a call back. I never heard back. Customer service is no good.
I went back a few weeks ago to purchase a new vehicle they were very happy to help me spend my money. I even explained what happened in the past. They said we can transfer the ceramic coating to our new car.
I did not believe they would follow up with their false promises . I did not want to waste my money on hiring another car or time leaving a vehicle there for a job not to be completed. I went to another dealership and purchased a new vehicle for my business.

user_reviews_extended.Name: jndk
user_reviews_extended.Description: Dealt with Michael H at LDV Parramatta. I was adamant on a blue G10 Executive. He knew the date I had to part with my previous vehicle. When my blue G10 was not ready, he was kind enough to loan me another G10 until my vehicle arrived. Due to issues with customs, my vehicle was sent back to Asia causing unforeseen delays. Being adamant about the blue, Michael rang other dealers around the country and ended up sourcing my blue G10 from Western Australia. By the time we received our G10, we'd already had the loan vehicle for several weeks at no cost. Michael constantly kept me up to date with phone calls, emails and SMS's. A true professional salesman. This is what you call customer service. Highly recommend LDV Parramatta to anyone in the market for an LDV.

user_reviews_extended.Description:
That's really frustrating! I bought the LDV D90 last year because it had great features and was spacious. But before my first service, a part on the back side came out. During the first service, I mentioned the issue to the service provider, and they said they would organize the car part for me. I was expecting a call, but they never got back to me. After a few months, I called and asked about the part, and they said they had received it. Such bad service!

Yesterday, when I booked my car to get the part fixed, they told me I had to keep my car there for the whole day. They had initially said it would only take an hour. I couldn't stay the whole day because I had no other way to get home. At the service center, a person named Kris said they would call and book my car for the part fix. But yesterday passed, and I haven't received any call or message from the service center.

I don't think I should recommend LDV to anyone else. If the service center treats existing customers like this, I wonder how they would serve new customers. It's disappointing.
